messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Amy Steinberg's coming to Charlotte, NC!!
messages.msgSnippet: Everyone closer than me should *run* to Caren s house!!! Please give that Goddess a Big Hug for me, filled with PureLove
messages.messageBody:
Everyone closer than me should *run* to Caren's house!!!
Please give that Goddess a Big Hug for me, filled with PureLove <3
Then come see her again at Life Is Good <http://lifeisgoodconference.com>,
where she's playing a concert for my birthday!
(see! I'm sharing with the whole Tribe!)

On Sat, Mar 1, 2008 at 7:43 AM, Caren Knox-Hundley <carenkh@...>
wrote:

> TOO hot! And it takes forEV-ER, so we drive.)
>
> Amy will be performing Sunday, April 13th at 2pm. I am issuing this
> invitation to anyone who would like to see her - as many as can fit
> are welcome in my home. We are 3: me, Evan, 15 and Seth, 9, a dog
> that barks at strangers in our home (Kelly - any advice there? oh,
> yeah - training), and 3 cats, one of whom will make mad, passionate
> love to your thigh if you sit or lie down for any length of time in
> his vicinity. (He's fixed, no worries about cross-pollination)
> Doesn't that sound inviting? Also: Legos, Bionicles, XBox360, PS2,
> GameCube & DS, large back yard with a tree swing, and understanding
> neighbors. Alas, *not* 2000 Kapla blocks.
>
> E-me offlist: dharmamama1 (at) gmail (dot) com
>
> I am woefully unfamiliar with all of Amy's work, but lurrrrv her song
> "Exactly", and I know of other unschoolers who would chew through
> barbed wire to see her. Or, at least, they'd work hard to find the
> gate. Her myspace: http://www.myspace.com/amysteinberg
>
> Today, there is life - let's live it!
>
> Caren
> http://openheartedlife.blogspot.com/

xoxoxoxo

messages.subject: Amy Steinberg's coming to Charlotte, NC!!
messages.msgSnippet: Yee-ha! Just got an e-mail from Pura Vida, a gorgeous, funky, amazing and fun shop & gallery, owned by the gorgeous, funky, amazing and fun Teresa Hernandez.
messages.messageBody:
Yee-ha! Just got an e-mail from Pura Vida, a gorgeous, funky, amazing
and fun shop & gallery, owned by the gorgeous, funky, amazing and fun
Teresa Hernandez. http://www.puravidaart.com/ The shop is a short
walk from my home. (Unless you're Seth, then it's lo-o-o-o-ong, and
TOO hot! And it takes forEV-ER, so we drive.)

Amy will be performing Sunday, April 13th at 2pm. I am issuing this
invitation to anyone who would like to see her - as many as can fit
are welcome in my home. We are 3: me, Evan, 15 and Seth, 9, a dog
that barks at strangers in our home (Kelly - any advice there? oh,
yeah - training), and 3 cats, one of whom will make mad, passionate
love to your thigh if you sit or lie down for any length of time in
his vicinity. (He's fixed, no worries about cross-pollination)
Doesn't that sound inviting? Also: Legos, Bionicles, XBox360, PS2,
GameCube & DS, large back yard with a tree swing, and understanding
neighbors. Alas, *not* 2000 Kapla blocks.

E-me offlist: dharmamama1 (at) gmail (dot) com

I am woefully unfamiliar with all of Amy's work, but lurrrrv her song
"Exactly", and I know of other unschoolers who would chew through
barbed wire to see her. Or, at least, they'd work hard to find the
gate. Her myspace: http://www.myspace.com/amysteinberg

Today, there is life - let's live it!

Caren
http://openheartedlife.blogspot.com/



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
